Submodules

songs.admin module

class songs.admin.AlbumAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin class for managing Album models.

This admin class allows the management of Album objects in the Django admin interface. It provides a customized display of Album instances with specified fields.

list_display

A tuple specifying the fields to be displayed in the list view of Album instances, including ‘artist’, ‘albumName’, ‘created’, and ‘last_updated’.

Type:

tuple

list_display = ('artist', 'albumName', 'created', 'last_updated')
property media
class songs.admin.ArtistAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin class for managing Artist models.

This admin class allows the management of Artist objects in the Django admin interface. It provides a customized display of Artist instances with specified fields.

list_display

A tuple specifying the fields to be displayed in the list view of Artist instances, including ‘id’, ‘artistName’, ‘created’, and ‘last_updated’.

Type:

tuple

list_display = ('id', 'artistName', 'created', 'last_updated')
property media
class songs.admin.SongAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin class for managing Song models.

This admin class allows the management of Song objects in the Django admin interface. It provides a customized display of Song instances with specified fields.

list_display

A tuple specifying the fields to be displayed in the list view of Song instances, including ‘id’, ‘album’, ‘song’, ‘songName’, ‘songThumbnail’, ‘created’, and ‘last_updated’.

Type:

tuple

list_display = ('id', 'album', 'song', 'songName', 'songThumbnail', 'created', 'last_updated')
property media

Model representing an album.

A foreign key relationship to the Artist model, representing the album’s artist.

Type:

ForeignKey

The name of the album.

Type:

CharField

created

The date and time when the album was created.

Type:

DateTimeField

last_updated

The date and time when the album information was last updated.

Type:

DateTimeField

Meta:

verbose_name (str): A human-readable name for the model, set to “Album”. verbose_name_plural (str): A human-readable name for the model in plural form, set to “Albums”.

Returns a string representation of the album, which is the album’s name.

artist

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
song_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Model representing a song.

A foreign key relationship to the Album model, representing the song’s album.

Type:

ForeignKey

songThumbnail

An image field for the song’s thumbnail with upload path ‘thumbnail/’.

Type:

ImageField

song

A file field for the song with upload path ‘music/’.

Type:

FileField

The name of the song.

Type:

CharField

Type:

DateTimeField

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
song

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)
songName

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

songThumbnail

Just like the FileDescriptor, but for ImageFields. The only difference is assigning the width/height to the width_field/height_field, if appropriate.

songs.tests module

songs.urls module

songs.views module

songs.views.songs(request)[source]

Render a list of songs.

This view retrieves all the Song objects from the database using the Song model’s manager (all() method) and renders them in a template named ‘songs.html’. The retrieved songs are passed to the template as a context variable named ‘allSongs’.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

The HTTP response rendering the ‘songs.html’ template with a context containing all the songs retrieved from the database.

Return type:

HttpResponse
